Congo
Stuck deep in the Congo jungle, you and your teammates are hunted by packs of demons lurking in the darkest areas. Light is your friend in this hostile environment. Scavenge equipment and utilize good teamwork to secure your route of escape in this top-down co-op horror game.

Title: Congo
Genre: Action , Indie , Early Access
Developer: The Innocent Devils
Publisher: The Innocent Devils
Release Date: Nov 27, 2014

Visit the website View the manual View update history Read related news View discussions Find Community Groups
Share Embed  

Early Access Game

Get instant access and start playing; get involved with this game as it develops.

Note: This Early Access game is not complete and may or may not change further. If you are not excited to play this game in its current state, then you should wait to see if the game progresses further in development. Learn more

What the developers have to say:

Why Early Access?

“Congo is in the very early stages of development and does not necessarily offer the amount of content that you may expect from a full release. Please be aware, when purchasing, that this game is limited in its current state, but will be updated on a regular basis with more features and content. We're excited to get your feedback and we actively invite you to tell us your thoughts and help us develop the best possible game.

We are dedicated to creating an experience that's fun and memorable for the players, and we can only achieve that by getting it in front of you and the gaming community as early as possible. We want to mold and shape the game around what you want from it and produce a fulfilling experience.

Like many other indie teams around the world, Early Access has given us the ability to continue developing and continue producing a game despite being faced with some fundamental issues. With the support from you, we are able to continue developing Congo and making it the game it should be, and in return we can make the game exactly what you want to see and hopefully produce a really fun experience.”

Approximately how long will this game be in Early Access?

“Congo is still in the early stages of development and there's still a long way to go. But with the support and feedback from you, we can hopefully get there sooner and with a better final product.

We are hoping to be out of Early Access within 12 months, depending on the feedback and support from the community.”

How is the full version planned to differ from the Early Access version?

“Our Early Access version has all the soul and heart of our final product, but doesn't yet have the level of content that should be acceptable for a full release. For the full release we want to have more maps, more equipment, more weapons, more experiences and more features available to you.”

What is the current state of the Early Access version?

“Congo currently sports a base-level of equipment, weapons and a very limited number of maps. The core elements of the game are there and can be experienced. The back-end technical aspects such as the networking and player-matching are quite rough at the moment but constantly making updates and have achieved so much already - there's only more to come.”

Will the game be priced differently during and after Early Access?

“Pricing for the full version hasn't been confirmed yet, but we will be aiming at the lower end of the price scale.”

How are you planning on involving the Community in your development process?

“One of the most exciting things about releasing our game on Steam, is that the community is so strong and we really want to offer the players a route to tell us your thoughts and get involved. We have a forum at http://congothegame.boards.net/ where we'd love to hear your thoughts and we're always up for people getting in touch via Twitter @Congothegame and our facebook page https://www.facebook.com/CongotheGame ”
Read more

Recent updates View all (21)

October 28

Congo v0.4a Released



So v0.4a is out today! It's a big one today with 2 extra maps and some massive improvements to the AI and the AI performance! We're getting closer and closer to final release each day that goes past. Check out some of the new additions to this version :)

New Map: Training level
We have released a new training level. You can access this from the main menu.. Its currently a singleplayer map that will explain some of the features of Congo and allows you to mess around inside the military camp.





New Map: Abandoned Caves
For once it's day time... Safe and sound in the light of day but as you and your team make your way through the jungle the jeep runs out of fuel.. Venture into the caves in search for fuel and survive long enough to make it out.





New Defense Map: Caves
Protect the objective against swarms of cave demons. Look for fuel to help fuel the generator and search the caverns for equipment.





New Achievements
To go with the new objective level, we have some more achievements for you to gather!

Defense levels - more crates!
We've added more crates to defense levels. We felt that there weren't enough crates in the defense levels and left teams without enough equipment to do the job. This spawn rate is still under review so let us know what you think of this version!

Defense levels - GPS
All defense levels now include a GPS at spawn... Choose wisely on who on the team needs in most.

Progress Rings
A small change but progress rings are now three times the size. Should be a little clearer now ;)

Performance Increase on AI Swarm
We've made a number of changes to the demon's AI which in turn has made the system more efficient. The changes are most obvious during swarms and especially final swarms when theres a lot of demons spawned.

Adjusted Accuracy and Targeting
We've tweaked the aiming and targeting system some more to make it smoother and more reliable.

Tonnes of Bug fixes and Tweaks!
We've been working feverish and have ironed out countless bugs and issues (including the mysterious "ghost" demon that could take down a player without being seen...).



As always, let us know what you think! Be sure to check back soon for some good deals on Congo :)

6 comments Read more

August 23

Congo v0.4 Released Today!



Congo v0.4 is out today! We're happy to announce that after an unexpectedly long wait, we have managed to get this update out and it comes with a lot of taste-y ingredients.

First of all, we have fixed the voice chat bug! A very frustrating bug that blocked Steam chat and the in-game voice chat would fail after a few minutes. A very simple fix on our end but came about right in the migration to Unreal Engine 4.8... which came with weeks of configuring everything to the new version and integrating all the great improvements that came with a more recent version of Unreal Engine.



So captains, below is the patch notes! :

Congo v0.4 Patch Notes

Re-Designed Aiming System
We've totally re-worked the aiming system from the ground up. The current players among you will see that the aiming point no longer shows unless targeted on an enemy. The targeting system is now more fluid and intuitive than before and each weapon influences the targeting system in different ways.

Fixed Steam Voice Chat Bug
We have fixed the voice chat bug!

Player Names on by Default
Player names now show by default. Press Tab to hide.

Update to 4.8
This is a huge element to this release and has come with huge benefits to Congo. We have managed to take advantage of countless performance optimizations and fixed tonnes of bugs!

Dynamic Navigation
The navigation system for the demons is now fully dynamic thanks to upgrades in the Unreal Engine navigation system. The navigation can now be built at run-time with amazing efficiency. There were some areas of the maps where demons couldn't access because they were initially blocked. They can now access anywhere that's plausible.. You're not as safe as you used to be..

Enhanced AI
Enhancements to the demon AI.



This Congo v0.4 release is easily one of the most stable builds yet thanks to weeks and weeks of re-development and we're really excited to be able to use this as a main foundation for new content-heavy releases. v0.5 will be seeing more levels added (a training level and a day time level), new weapons, new items, new achievements, updated menus and much more!

We'll be combining it with a number of marketing options available to us and hopefully we'll see an increase in the player base for you all to take advantage of and have other players to roam around the jungle with!

Please let us know your thoughts on v0.4 and we'll keep you all updated on the progress of the new content!

Reviews

“Congo is shaping up to be one of those games that grabs you instantly and refuses to let go until it spits you out the other side.”
http://1001-up.com/2014/10/16/egx-2014-congo-the-game/

About This Game

Stuck deep in the Congo jungle, you and your teammates are hunted by packs of demons lurking in the darkest areas. Light is your friend in this hostile environment. Scavenge equipment and utilize good teamwork to secure your route of escape in this top-down co-op horror game.

Key Features in the Current Release


  • Play Congo with up to 4 players. Scavenge, survive and help each other reach rescue!
  • Defend against the demons with an array of weapons and equipment.
  • Collect fuel to power generators to create safe zones lit with floodlights or set improvised traps.
  • Experience being hunted by packed of demons in the jungle! Stick together and help each other survive!
  • Light is your friend - Fend off the demons with flares, flashlights, torches and more.
  • Immerse yourself in a deep and hostile environment powered by Unreal Engine 4.
  • Utilize great team work by managing and sharing equipment and weapons.

What Will Be Coming


Feedback is the key to success in our opinion, and we want to get you in at the ground floor of development so we can shape and mold the game around what you want and we're dedicated to giving players like you, a fulfilling co-operative horror experience! There's a ton more content and features we aim to add in the coming future and we work hard to keep the content relevant and new.

Some of the things you will be seeing in the future:

  • More in-depth player matching / game joining systems.
  • More maps, more environments, more equipment and more weapons!
  • More ways to control your environment. More flexibility with the current items and equipment.
  • Developing the A.I. is key to getting the full experience. We're always working on fine-tuning and tweaking our A.I. to balance both realistic and fun behaviour.
  • More variety of environments and flora to create a truly immersive jungle environment.
  • More options for you and your character. Potentially including persistent character statistics for you and your team.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows 7 SP1 / Windows 8 / Windows 8.1
    • Processor: 2.3+ GHz
    • Memory: 4 GB RAM
    • Graphics: Direct X 11 Capable
    • DirectX: Version 11
    • Hard Drive: 1500 MB available space
    Recommended:
    • OS: Windows 7 SP1 / Windows 8 / Windows 8.1
    • Processor: 3.40 GHz
    • Memory: 8 GB RAM
    • Graphics: Direct X 11 Capable
    • DirectX: Version 11
    • Hard Drive: 1500 MB available space

The_Cpt_FROGGY

Posted: September 18
Early Access Review
Congo:
~~~~~

It is pitch black and you are stranded in the middle of the Congolese jungle. You keep hearing noises coming from the bush and the foliage is cracking everywhere you look around. All you have going for you is a torch in one hand and a machete in the other hand!

Congo is an action/survival game where you can play by yourself, but it’s primary aim to play on a co-op basis with up to 3 of your mates. You will be able to play in two type of mods; defence or objective. The defence mod currently has 8 different locations and the aim is to make sure you do not lose your radio transmitter and to stay alive as long as you can. For the objective mod, well I guess you can figure this one out. Whatever you prefer to play, you will have to explore the jungle to find additional weapons, gizmos and tools either in crates or on the ground. You will always start with your machete but crates will get you access to revolvers, machines and submachine guns, shotgun, carabines and of course a limited amount of ammunition. Just a little tip for you, make sure you collect as many knives as you can. You will be pinned down to the ground by one of these demons and the only way to kill them went they are on top of you is to use a knife. Gps, flares (which scare the demons), fuel can, cutters and revive syringes (you can’t revive yourself, so this is only if you play as a party) are pretty much your gizmos and tools.

The A.I. is actually very good, demons (Congolese Apes) will sneak around, move away if you flash them with light or use a flare on the ground and attack you at a prominent time for them. The atmosphere is genuinely scary and I really like the fog of war type of setup where you only see clearly around your character(s) which amplify the fear aspect of the game.

From the controls point of view and combat system, they are easy to use but I must admit that I would like to see an easy way to use items in the inventory. The graphics are good and polished.

Congo is an early access game and show great potential, worth giving it a go!

Positives:
~~~~~~~

- Scary atmosphere
- Great A.I.
- Polished graphics
- Achievements

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~

- Items in the inventory should be friendlier to use
- No trading cards

7.5/10

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

MORE THE_CPT_FROGGY REVIEWS HERE

FOLLOW THE CPT FROGGY CURATOR PAGE HERE

Early Access Review
Fantastic 4 player coop extravaganza! 8/10.

Pros:
-Grue's! Popping the f*** out of nowhere!
-Vast Jungle levels
-Decent use of lighting
-Detailed Environment
-Survival Horror at it's core
-Action packed
-Coop Campaign

Cons:
-Grue's ... Basically the game has the occasional invisible Demon Monkey(s) that decide not to render properly or w.e ... Since you can't see them coming you'll just get ♥♥♥♥♥ randomly ... Recommendation: Shoot everywhere! Hopefully you or your team will kill it ;D
-Only two mission based levels.
-Trees and flora get in your camera's view
-Early Access...so many Glitches and bugs @_@
-Executing the C4/Bomb explosion on the rocks can be a little frustrating. Everyone has to be in the correct area ... and not too close or else you somehow get caught in the blast.

aquanaut_19

Recommended
0.6 hrs on record
Posted: May 30
Early Access Review
Not a lot of games can produce a truly heart-rushing scare once you've played Alien : Isolation - but Congo is gnarly good at it !

Congo is primarily a top-down action title where the camera slightly pitches up to show a dark and uninviting expanse as you thread carefully in half-steps, and to great effect. The tension is immediate, the danger, even when yet manifested, instantly palpable. You barely see as far as where your modest torch - probably your best friend early in the game - will generously shed light on. Not of a lot of games offer a distinct advantage in wielding a gun over a 2-handed-firearm, as you can still hold the handmade 360-degrees beacon to spot foes (relatively) early on. And let me add that you start with just a big knife.

The enemy is intelligent, powerful, stealthy. Most of the time 1st contact starts with the sound of the enemy carefully brushing the vegetation, and still you have to rely on you best aurality to pinpoint exactly where the threat is approaching from. It knows how and when to attack, when to retreat for a renewed or flanked offensive, and it uses the element of surprise and teamwork to stalk and hit the invader - you, who is in the end of the day only trying to haul out of this sinister place of a jungle by night.

Congo is a game about pure survival from a place where every second takes a toll on your nerves, and a place where rushing blindly and pseudo-merrily will put your stride to an abrupt and violent end. A game still in development despite its "as is" robustness, but already showing great promise and a rather terrifying presence not often approached or executed as deftly.

The YES-Factor : sale or no sale, definitely worth going for.
NO Gamesman Land : can be bad for cardiovasculars (seriously) .

Early Access Review
So Anakin Skyhumper, Borgie, and myself finally beat the multiplayer mission. The 15 minutes of waiting for the chopper at the end was one of the most intense moments in a game there ever was. I was Literally tensed so much my muscals hurt in my hands and arms. I never blinked, eyes hurt so much. SO MANY DEMONS!!! we had burned over 200 bullets on the helipad, and still had to pull out the Machete to finish. That Moment when the Helicopter lands and you Press that "E" button for rescue...holy ♥♥♥♥ moment..you sit back in your chair and realize that you did it... 10/10 is my review and I want to say Thank you SO Much for the experience.
